definition: to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Dashu knows to lower his head when he wants to get under his bed.
sentences.chinese: 大树爬进小床的时候会把头低下，匍匐前进。

sentences.english: He tilted his head to one side, and his eyes were curious.
sentences.chinese: 他把头偏向一侧，眼里充满了好奇。

sentences.english: The two girls and Jordan leaned together confidentially.
sentences.chinese: 两个姑娘和乔丹诡秘地把头靠到一起。

sentences.english: Giovanni leaned out of the window so he could see her better.
sentences.chinese: 乔瓦尼把头探出窗外，以便他能看到她的好。

sentences.english: I'm still feeling a little woozy, so I rest my head on his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然感到有点头晕，所以我把头靠在他的肩上。

sentences.english: I 'd like my parting move to the left.
sentences.chinese: 我想要把头路移到左边。

sentences.english: The little girl was somewhat shy, her head falling on her mother's shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩有些怕生，把头靠在她母亲的肩上。

sentences.english: And what you do is you sort of you turn away.
He reposed his head on the pillow.
Blushing, she turns her head without a qualm.
He peered his head out into the tunnel and saw her.
sentences.chinese: 他把头伸过去盯着隧道，接着他看到了她。

sentences.english: I recline my head on my soft pillow.
sentences.chinese: 我把头靠在我柔软的枕头上。

sentences.english: The librarian threw back his head and laughed shrilly.
sentences.chinese: 图书管理员把头往后面一仰，尖着嗓子哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: She burrowed her head in the pillow and cried and kicked her feet at the tufted counterpane .
sentences.chinese: 她把头埋在枕头里，一面哭一面用双脚乱踢着被子。

sentences.english: The lion put his head down into the well. But he found that it was the home of mosquitoes.
sentences.chinese: 这头狮子把头伸进井里，发现它是蚊子的家。

sentences.english: Noel turned away, burying his face in the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 诺埃尔转过身，把头埋在枕头底下。

definition: to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
